## Key Design Decisions

### 1. Governance-First
- Schema Registry and Policy Engine implemented **before** service logic
- Ensures system is "born governed"
- Prevents anti-patterns from being introduced

### 2. Synchronous Snapshot Triggers
- Evaluated immediately after event append
- Meets 5-second latency requirement
- Fire-and-forget async creation

### 3. Dual-Path Event Propagation
- Kinesis/Kafka for core events (low latency)
- SNS/SQS/RabbitMQ for non-critical (resilient)
- Optimizes cost vs. latency trade-off

### 4. Ports & Adapters
- Domain logic has zero cloud dependencies
- Adapters are plug-and-play
- Switch providers via configuration

### 5. Consolidated Read Model
- Single OpenSearch/Elasticsearch instance
- Reduces operational complexity
- Maintains query performance

## Performance Targets

| Metric | Target | Measured By |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| Command Processing | < 200ms (p99) | CloudWatch/Prometheus |
| Event Propagation | < 500ms (p99) | End-to-end tracing |
| Projection Lag | < 2 seconds | Timestamp diff |
| Snapshot Trigger | < 5 seconds | Synchronous evaluation |
| Throughput | 10,000+ events/sec | Load testing |

## Security & Compliance

- **Authentication**: IAM, OAuth2, or custom
- **Authorization**: Role-based access control
- **Encryption**: At rest and in transit
- **Audit**: Complete event log (immutable)
- **Policy Enforcement**: OPA in CI/CD
- **Rate Limiting**: Temporal queries (10 req/min)

## Observability

- **Metrics**: CloudWatch, Prometheus, or custom
- **Tracing**: X-Ray, Jaeger, or OpenTelemetry
- **Logging**: Structured logs with correlation IDs
- **Dashboards**: Command, Event, Query, Health
- **Alerts**: Projection lag, DLQ depth, errors

---

**The architecture is cloud-agnostic. AWS is just the default.**
